item.title: Report E-2024110166
item.description:
Report E-2024110166

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-10T12:20:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-30
  • City: KEARNY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 30, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of tea tree oil was punctured and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the tea tree oil-impacted loading dock floor. The damaged drum was overpacked into one (1) 95-gallon overpack and all impacted waste and absorbents were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums for future disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024110102
item.description:
Report X-2024110102

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-07T12:22:36+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-04
  • City: NEWARK
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 11/3/2024 at approximately 2145, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 435751 at the ramp facility in Newark, reporting a dangerous goods spill. The shipment consisted of 3 glass bottles, each containing 8 oz of liquid, packaged in one fiberboard box. Due to human error, the shipment began to feel damp. Further investigation revealed that one of the bottles had broken, resulting in spillage. The damaged bottle was placed in a salvage drum for disposal and the remaining shipment was placed in a separate drum and awaits an amended Shipper's declaration for further transport.

Shipment also contains UN3481 Lithium ion batteries contained in equipment Class 9 Single Package or Inner Packaging(if any): Packaging Type: Case Material of Construction: Plastic Package Capacity: 130 g Amount in Package: 130 g Number in Shipment: 4 Number Failed: 4
